results.title: Getting on the bandwagon
results.creator_credit: Gudrun Parker, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: To stimulate discussion, questions the basis on which people form their tastes, illustrating the fairly common tendency to go along with the crowd and to stay on the safe side of a difference of opinion. When the parents of her close friend first see the painting of a new artist they consider them odd and unconventional, but after her work is discovered by a socially prominent family they join the chorus of approval. Invites the audiences to comment on the prevalence pf independence or conformity of thought.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gudrun Parker, Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Getting married
results.brief_description: Explores the whole problem of marrying young. Linda and Rodger aged 16 and 20 respectively, discuss their marriage plans with the vicar and their parents. Other couples who have married in their teens, talk about their attitude to sex before marriage and to contraception.

results.title: Getting it all together
results.creator_credit: Ron Saunders, Malcolm Smith and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Mansfield Park Junior Primary School is the locale for this film which emphasizes the usefulness and value of community involvement in the school. Two dozen mothers tell what it means to them to be part of Mansfield Park. In breaking down the barriers that often still exist between the community and the school, Mansfield Park encourages High School students to visit weekly. There is an exchange of learning. The students are told about the understanding of children between 2 and 5 year and the students in turn help with youngsters with their puzzles and paintings.

results.title: School and community: getting into the act
results.creator_credit: Ron V. Brown and R and R Productions
results.brief_description: Shows how communication between school councils and the school communities can benefit both bodies. Community education activities are shown which help to integrate the school and the outside community. Discusses the role of the school council in the provision of community education facilities and covers issues such as the composition of the council, evaluation of the council and the council as employer.

results.title: Get out and live
results.creator_credit: Col Lewis and Cameracraft Film Productions
results.brief_description:
This 1972 film, produced for the Main Roads Department, Brisbane, describes the establishment of an emergency control organisation within the department, and shows the training and implementation of an emergency evacuation of 1,500 people from the 14 storey office building.

Produced by Cameracraft Film Productions.

The colour is faded throughout the film and there are jumps in the soundtrack throughout due to missing frames.

Please note: As this is an archival work, the content does not reflect current practice or standards. Professional advice for up-to-date safety practices should be sought from the appropriate contemporary authority.

results.title: Get it together
results.creator_credit: Richard Miner, Herman S. Saunders and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Tells the true story of a young man who became a paraplegic as a result of a auto accident. Shows how he returned to college, married and began a career as a recreational therapist.

results.title: Gesell development and neurologic examination
results.brief_description: Child development from 16 weeks observing co-ordination and muscle growth and stimulation. At 52 weeks an infant starts changing into a toddler - learning balance and finally walking at about 56 weeks.

results.title: Germany: Key to Europe
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A report on the German problem, showing how events since World War II have made this divided nation an area of conflict between two ideologies. The film brings into focus the march of events that followed the country’s collapse and its military occupations. The political manoeuvres of the Social bloc to build a satellite state, in opposition to the wish of the Western powers for a unified, democratic Germany, are seen as major factors in the struggle.

results.title: Germany: A regional geography
results.creator_credit: Clive Rees, G. Buckland-Smith and Greenpark Productions
results.brief_description: Regional differentiation within Western Germany reflects the varied physical geography. Contrasts the Black Forest with the more active Rhinelands whose economic importance is accentuated by the proximity of the Ruhr coalfields. The historic south is in direct contrast with the recently reclaimed North Coast. The final sequence shows Berlin epitomising the East-West political division and the rapid post war economic recovery.
